definitions.definition: A butt or mark to shoot at, as for practice, or to test the accuracy of a firearm, or the force of a projectile.
definitions.example: Take careful aim at the target.
They have a target to finish the project by November.

definitions.definition: A kind of small shield or buckler, used as a defensive weapon in war.
A shield resembling the Roman scutum, larger than the modern buckler.
The pattern or arrangement of a series of hits made by a marksman on a butt or mark.
The sliding crosspiece, or vane, on a leveling staff.
A conspicuous disk attached to a switch lever to show its position, or for use as a signal.
The number of runs that the side batting last needs to score in the final innings in order to win
The translated version of a document, or the language into which translation occurs.
definitions.example: Do you charge by source or target?

definitions.definition: A person (or group of people) that a person or organization is trying to employ or to have as a customer, audience etc.
A thin cut; a slice; specifically, of lamb, a piece consisting of the neck and breast joints.
To aim something, especially a weapon, at (a target).
To aim for as an audience or demographic.
definitions.example: The advertising campaign targeted older women.
This cross-platform compiler can target any of several processors.
